wikipedia_page.main: Howard R. Davies (27 June 1895 – 3 January 1973), was an English motorcycle racing champion, motorcycle designer and originator of the 'HRD' marque which later became Vincent-HRD motorcycles. He died in January 1973.

response: * Howard R. Davies (1895–1973), English originator of the historic HRD motorcycle marque and motorcycle racer
* Howard R. Davies (1895–1973) – motorcycle racing champion and motorcycle designer
* Howard R. Davies, motorcycle racing champion

* The Senior motorcycle road race day at the Isle of Man Tourist Trophy competition finished with Cyril Pullin placing first while Howard R. Davies and Oliver Godfrey, the winner of the Tourist Trophy in 1911, both finished second in a dead heat. IOM TT The Four Inch Course (Retrieved 25 November 2006)
